text:
September 25th, 1952
Mr. Gray don Ausmus
WUOA
University of Alabama
University, Alabama
Dear Graydon:
I have hardly had a chance to write to you concerning the
recent tiring experience abroad. A formal report will be
forthcoming which, I am certain, will present highly con¬
structive facts. The trip, while it took a great deal out
of us, will re stilt in the greatest flow of cultural material
in the history of America.
The purpose of this note is to acknowledge your memo of
September 22nd concerning Earl Wynn. I must confess that
I am completely behind on what has gone on. What ’'committee"
are you referring to when you say "The question this committee
should consider at this point .... etc. " ?
Please fill me in.
Best wishes
Seymour N. Siegel
President
ana ft
